verbose_text: Therefore, SNHG14 participates in RB carcinogenesis in vitro by serving as a ceRNA that sponges miR-124, consequently inhibiting the miR-124-induced repression of its direct target gene STAT3.
evidence: RB carcinogenesis in vitro by serving as a ceRNA that sponges miR-124, consequently inhibiting the miR-124-induced repression of its direct target gene STAT3
